/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
Xenko 1.10β improves stability and performance and introduces changes in the asset serialization.
Xenko 1.10β melhora a estabilidade e o desempenho e introduz alterações na serialização de ativos.
Xenko 1.10β improves stability and performance and introduces changes in the asset serialization.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
Tool performance
Desempenho da ferramenta
Tool performance
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
This release comes packed with several performance improvements, especially in the Game Studio and Asset Compiler.
Esta versão vem repleta de várias melhorias de desempenho, especialmente no Game Studio e Asset Compiler.
This release comes packed with several performance improvements, especially in the Game Studio and Asset Compiler.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
We've rewritten how assets are loaded in the scene editor, resulting in a faster and smoother loading in the background, as well as reduced memory usage.
Reescritamos como os ativos são carregados no editor de cena, resultando em um carregamento mais rápido e mais suave no fundo, bem como o uso de memória reduzido.
We've rewritten how assets are loaded in the scene editor, resulting in a faster and smoother loading in the background, as well as reduced memory usage.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
We've made various improvements to the Asset Compiler startup time (important since we start multiple Asset Compilers to process FBX files).
Fizemos várias melhorias no tempo de inicialização do Asset Compiler (importante desde que começamos vários compiladores de ativos para processar arquivos FBX).
We've made various improvements to the Asset Compiler startup time (important since we start multiple Asset Compilers to process FBX files).
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
Also various key importers, such as the FBX importers, weren't scaling well with lots of polygons.
Também vários importadores-chave, como os importadores FBX, não estavam escalonando bem com muitos polígonos.
Also various key importers, such as the FBX importers, weren't scaling well with lots of polygons.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
The Content Bundle packing (run at the end of the Asset Compiler) can now work incrementally.
A embalagem do Pacote de Conteúdo (correr no final do Compilador de Ativos) agora pode funcionar de forma incremental.
The Content Bundle packing (run at the end of the Asset Compiler) can now work incrementally.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
Before, if you had several gigabytes of data but only changed a small asset, compilation was fast but saving the new bundle took a long time at the end of the build.
Antes, se você tinha vários gigabytes de dados, mas apenas mudou um pequeno ativo, a compilação foi rápida, mas salvar o novo pacote levou um longo tempo no final da compilação.
Before, if you had several gigabytes of data but only changed a small asset, compilation was fast but saving the new bundle took a long time at the end of the build.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
This operation should be almost instant now.
Esta operação deve ser quase instantânea agora.
This operation should be almost instant now.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
Unique GUID inside an asset
GUID único dentro de um ativo
Unique GUID inside an asset
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md

While not a breaking change, we've introduced a new paradigm in our asset infrastructure, implying that any <g1>identifiable</g1> object (ie any object that implements <g2>IIdentifiable</g2> interface) must have a unique identifier in the asset containing it.

Embora não seja uma mudança de ruptura, introduzimos um novo paradigma em nossa infraestrutura de ativos, implicando que qualquer objeto <g1>identifiável</g1> (ou seja, qualquer objeto que implemente a interface <g2>IIdentifiable</g2>) deve ter um identificador único no ativo que o contém.

While not a breaking change, we've introduced a new paradigm in our asset infrastructure, implying that any <g1>identifiable</g1> object (ie any object that implements <g2>IIdentifiable</g2> interface) must have a unique identifier in the asset containing it.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
This constraint makes it easier to handle internal references inside an asset.
Esta restrição torna mais fácil lidar com referências internas dentro de um ativo.
This constraint makes it easier to handle internal references inside an asset.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md

Since it wasn't enforced before, <g1>the first time you open an existing project with version 1.10, you might see warnings stating that the identifiers of some objects have been rewritten</g1> (especially entity components and scripts).

Uma vez que não foi aplicada antes, <g1>a primeira vez que você abre um projeto existente com a versão 1.10, você pode ver avisos afirmando que os identificadores de alguns objetos foram reescritos</g1> (especialmente componentes de entidades e scripts).

Since it wasn't enforced before, <g1>the first time you open an existing project with version 1.10, you might see warnings stating that the identifiers of some objects have been rewritten</g1> (especially entity components and scripts).
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
This is expected and should be harmless.
Isso é esperado e deve ser inofensivo.
This is expected and should be harmless.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-1.10.md
The warnings shouldn't appear the next time you open the project.
Os avisos não devem aparecer da próxima vez que abrir o projeto.
The warnings shouldn't appear the next time you open the project.
